function.name: gst_rtsp_find_header_field
function.description: Convert @header to a #GstRTSPHeaderField.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_set_sample
function.description:
Make sure that the next sample written to the device is accounted for as being the @sample sample written to the device. This value will be used in reporting the current sample position of the ringbuffer.
This function will also clear the buffer with silence.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_default_registry_mixer_filter
function.description:
Utility function to find audio mixer elements.
Will traverse the default plugin registry in order of plugin rank and find usable audio mixer elements. The caller may optionally fine-tune the selection by specifying a filter function.

parameter.name: first
parameter.parameter_description: set to #TRUE if you only want the first suitable mixer element

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the filter function

function.return:
a #GList of audio mixer #GstElement<!-- -->s. You must free each element in the list by setting it to NULL state and calling gst_object_unref(). After that the list itself should be freed using g_list_free().
Since: 0.10.2

function.name: gst_tuner_list_channels
function.description: Retrieve a #GList of #GstTunerChannels available (e.g. 'composite', 's-video', ...) from the given tuner object.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the channels from.

function.return: A list of channels available on this tuner. The list is owned by the GstTuner and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_property_probe_needs_probe
function.description: Checks whether a property needs a probe. This might be because the property wasn't initialized before, or because host setup changed. This might be, for example, because a new device was added, and thus device probing needs to be refreshed to display the new device.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe object to which the given property belongs.

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: a #GParamSpec that identifies the property to check.

function.return: TRUE if the property needs a new probe, FALSE if not.

function.return: A newly allocated buffer with @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_prepare_xwindow_id
function.description:
This will post a "prepare-xwindow-id" element message on the bus to give applications an opportunity to call gst_x_overlay_set_xwindow_id() before a plugin creates its own window.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstXOverlay which does not yet have an XWindow.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_add_attribute
function.description: Add the attribute with @key and @value to @media.
function.return: #GST_SDP_OK.

function.name: gst_tuner_set_frequency
function.description:
Sets a tuning frequency on the given tuner/channel. Note that this requires the given channel to be a "tuning" channel, which can be checked using GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_HAS_FLAG (), with the proper flag being GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY.
The frequency is in Hz, with minimum steps indicated by the frequency_multiplicator provided in the #GstTunerChannel. The valid range is provided in the min_frequency and max_frequency properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The #Gsttuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTunerChannel to set the frequency on.

parameter.name: frequency
parameter.parameter_description: The frequency to tune in to.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_calc_packet_len
function.description: Calculate the total length of an RTP packet with a payload size of @payload_len, a padding of @pad_len and a @csrc_count CSRC entries.
function.return: The total length of an RTP header with given parameters.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_type
function.description: Get the message type of @msg.
function.return: the message type.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data
function.description: Check if the @data and @size point to the data of a valid RTCP (compound) packet. Use this function to validate a packet before using the other functions in this module.
function.return: TRUE if the data points to a valid RTCP packet.

Fill the ringbuffer with silence.

function.name: gst_mixer_options_list_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the list of possible options of a given options object has changed.
The new options are not contained in the message on purpose. Applications should call gst_mixer_option_get_values() on @opts to make @opts update its internal state and obtain the new list of values.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus for this to work.
Since: 0.10.18

parameter.name: opts
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerOptions whose list of values has changed

The valid range of the signal strength is indicated in the min_signal and max_signal properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

function.name: gst_tag_freeform_string_to_utf8
function.description: Convenience function to read a string with unknown character encoding. If the string is already in UTF-8 encoding, it will be returned right away. Otherwise, the environment will be searched for a number of environment variables (whose names are specified in the NULL-terminated string array @env_vars) containing a list of character encodings to try/use. If none are specified, the current locale will be tried. If that also doesn't work, ISO-8859-1 is assumed (which will almost always succeed).

function.name: gst_tag_image_data_to_image_buffer
function.description:
Helper function for tag-reading plugins to create a #GstBuffer suitable to add to a #GstTagList as an image tag (such as #GST_TAG_IMAGE or #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE) from the encoded image data and an (optional) image type.
Background: cover art and other images in tags are usually stored as a blob of binary image data, often accompanied by a MIME type or some other content type string (e.g. 'png', 'jpeg', 'jpg'). Sometimes there is also an 'image type' to indicate what kind of image this is (e.g. front cover, back cover, artist, etc.). The image data may also be an URI to the image rather than the image itself.
In GStreamer, image tags are #GstBuffer<!-- -->s containing the raw image data, with the buffer caps describing the content type of the image (e.g. image/jpeg, image/png, text/uri-list). The buffer caps may contain an additional 'image-type' field of #GST_TYPE_TAG_IMAGE_TYPE to describe the type of image (front cover, back cover etc.). #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE tags should not carry an image type, their type is already indicated via the special tag name.
This function will do various checks and typefind the encoded image data (we can't trust the declared mime type).

parameter.name: image_data_len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the encoded image data at @image_data

parameter.name: image_type

function.return:
a newly-allocated image buffer for use in tag lists, or NULL
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_video_format_get_row_stride
function.description:
Calculates the row stride (number of bytes from one row of pixels to the next) for the video component with an index of @component. For YUV video, Y, U, and V have component indices of 0, 1, and 2, respectively. For RGB video, R, G, and B have component indicies of 0, 1, and 2, respectively. Alpha channels, if present, have a component index of 3. The @width parameter always represents the width of the video, not the component.
Since: 0.10.16
function.return: row stride of component @component

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: where the data should be read

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples in data to read

function.return:
The number of samples read from the ringbuffer or -1 on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_framerate
function.description:
Extracts the frame rate from @caps and places the values in the locations pointed to by @fps_n and @fps_d. Returns TRUE if the values could be parsed correctly, FALSE if not.
This function can be used with #GstCaps that have any media type; it is not limited to formats handled by #GstVideoFormat.

parameter.name: fps_n

parameter.name: fps_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to integer to hold denominator of frame rate (output)

function.name: gst_install_plugins_supported

TRUE if plugin installation is likely to be supported.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_extension_data

parameter.name: length

True if done.
Since : 0.10.18

When @type refers to a text item, @data will point to a UTF8 string. Note that this UTF8 string is NOT null-terminated. Use gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_copy_entry() to get a null-termined copy of the entry.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_ext_timestamp

Update the @exttimestamp field with @timestamp. For the first call of the method, @exttimestamp should point to a location with a value of -1.

The extended timestamp of @timestamp.

function.name: gst_audio_set_structure_channel_positions_list
function.description: Sets a (possibly non-fixed) list of possible audio channel positions (given in pos) on the given structure. The structure, after this function has been called, will contain a "channel-positions" field with an array of the size of the "channels" field value in the given structure (note that this means that the channels field in the provided structure should be fixed!). Each value in the array will contain each of the values given in the pos array.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: #GstStructure to set the list of channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the array containing one or more possible audio channel positions that we should add in each value of the array in the given structure.

parameter.name: num_positions
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values in pos.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerTrack object, or NULL.

function.name: gst_audio_fixate_channel_positions

It will take care of equal channel positioning (left/right). Caller g_free()s the return value. The input properties may be (and are supposed to be) unfixed. Note that this function is mostly a hack because we currently have no way to add default fixation functions for new GTypes.

function.name: gst_fft_s16_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTS16 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_pixel_aspect_ratio
function.description:
Extracts the pixel aspect ratio from @caps and places the values in the locations pointed to by @par_n and @par_d. Returns TRUE if the values could be parsed correctly, FALSE if not.
This function can be used with #GstCaps that have any media type; it is not limited to formats handled by #GstVideoFormat.
Since: 0.10.16

parameter.name: par_n
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to numerator of pixel aspect ratio (output)

parameter.name: par_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to denominator of pixel aspect ratio (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_context_set_xid
function.description:
This function is for X11-based applications (such as most Gtk/Qt applications on linux/unix) only. You can use it to tell the external installer the XID of your main application window. That way the installer can make its own window transient to your application window during the installation.
If set, the XID will be passed to the installer via a --transient-for=XID command line option.
Gtk+/Gnome application should be able to obtain the XID of the top-level window like this: <programlisting> ##include <gtk/gtk.h> ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 ##include <gdk/gdkx.h> ##endif ... ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 xid = GDK_WINDOW_XWINDOW (GTK_WIDGET (application_window)->window); ##endif ... </programlisting>
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: xid
parameter.parameter_description: the XWindow ID (XID) of the top-level application

function.name: gst_audio_set_caps_channel_positions_list
function.description: Sets a (possibly non-fixed) list of possible audio channel positions (given in pos) on the given caps. Each of the structures of the caps, after this function has been called, will contain a "channel-positions" field with an array. Each value in the array will contain each of the values given in the pos array. Note that the size of the caps might be increased by this, since each structure with a "channel- positions" field needs to have a fixed "channels" field. The input caps is not required to have this.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps to set the list of channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the array containing one or more possible audio channel positions that we should add in each value of the array in the given structure.

parameter.name: num_positions
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values in pos.

function.name: gst_audio_get_channel_positions
function.description: Retrieves a number of (fixed!) audio channel positions from the provided #GstStructure and returns it as a newly allocated array. The caller should g_free () this array. The caller should also check that the members in this #GstStructure are indeed "fixed" before calling this function.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstStructure to retrieve channel positions from.

function.return: a newly allocated array containing the channel positions as provided in the given #GstStructure. Returns NULL on error.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_async
function.description:
Requests plugin installation without blocking. Once the plugins have been installed or installation has failed, @func will be called with the result of the installation and your provided @user_data pointer.
This function requires a running GLib/Gtk main loop. If you are not running a GLib/Gtk main loop, make sure to regularly call g_main_context_iteration(NULL,FALSE).
The installer strings that make up @detail are typically obtained by calling gst_missing_plugin_message_get_installer_detail() on missing-plugin messages that have been caught on a pipeline's bus or created by the application via the provided API, such as gst_missing_element_message_new().
It is possible to request the installation of multiple missing plugins in one go (as might be required if there is a demuxer for a certain format installed but no suitable video decoder and no suitable audio decoder).

parameter.name: details
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of installer string details (see below)

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call when the installer program returns

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the user data to pass to @func when called, or NULL

function.return:
result code whether an external installer could be started
Since: 0.10.12

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_option_changed

Extracts the GstMixerOptions and new value from a option-changed bus notification message.
The options and value returned remain valid until the message is freed.
Since: 0.10.14

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerOptions object, or NULL.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Result location to receive the new options value, or NULL.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_decoder_description
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which an decoder description is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_set_key
function.description: Adds the encryption information to @msg.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_free
function.description: Free the memory used by @msg.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_property_probe_needs_probe_name
function.description: Same as gst_property_probe_needs_probe ().

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe object to which the given property belongs.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to check.

function.return: TRUE if the property needs a new probe, FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_get_media
function.description: Get the media description at index @idx in @msg.
function.return: a #GstSDPMedia.

function.name: gst_rtsp_base64_encode
function.description: Encode a sequence of binary data into its Base-64 stringified representation.
function.return: a newly allocated, zero-terminated Base-64 encoded string representing @data.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_ssrc
function.description: Get the SSRC of the current SDES item.
function.return: the SSRC of the current item.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_move_to_next
function.description: Move the packet pointer @packet to the next packet in the payload. Use gst_rtcp_buffer_get_first_packet() to initialize @packet.
function.return: TRUE if @packet is pointing to a valid packet after calling this function.

function.name: gst_fft_f32_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTF32 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

parameter.name: inverse
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the #GstFFTF32 instance should be used for the inverse FFT

function.return: a new #GstFFTF32 instance.

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip6_address
function.description: Set @naddr with the IPv6 @address and @port pair.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_prepare_read
function.description: Returns: FALSE if the buffer is not started.

parameter.name: readptr
parameter.parameter_description: the pointer to the memory where samples can be read

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to read

function.return:
FALSE if the buffer is not started.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_as_text
function.description: Convert the contents of @media to a text string.
function.return: A dynamically allocated string representing the media.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_set_origin
function.description: Configure the SDP origin in @msg with the given parameters.
function.return: #GST_SDP_OK.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_expose
function.description: Tell an overlay that it has been exposed. This will redraw the current frame in the drawable even if the pipeline is PAUSED.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @src.
function.return:
The current slave method used by @src.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_tag_parse_extended_comment
function.description:
Convenience function to parse a GST_TAG_EXTENDED_COMMENT string and separate it into its components.
If successful, @key, @lang and/or @value will be set to newly allocated strings that you need to free with g_free() when done. @key and @lang may also be set to NULL by this function if there is no key or no language code in the extended comment string.

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the comment description key, or NULL

parameter.name: lang
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the comment ISO-639 language code, or NULL

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the actual comment string, or NULL

parameter.name: fail_if_no_key
parameter.parameter_description: whether to fail if strings are not in key=value form

function.return:
TRUE if the string could be parsed, otherwise FALSE
Since: 0.10.10

function.name: gst_video_format_parse_caps
function.description:
Determines the #GstVideoFormat of @caps and places it in the location pointed to by @format. Extracts the size of the video and places it in the location pointed to by @width and @height. If @caps does not represent one of the raw video formats listed in #GstVideoFormat, the function will fail and return FALSE.
Since: 0.10.16

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat of the video represented by @caps (output)

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @sink.
function.return:
The current slave method used by @sink.
Since: 0.10.16

function.name: gst_mixer_get_option
function.description: Get the current value of a name/value option in the mixer.
function.return: current value of the name/value option.

function.name: str_case_hash
function.description: Hashes @key in a case-insensitive manner.
function.return: the hash code.

function.name: GstBaseAudioSrc
function.description:
Actual configured audio latency in microseconds.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_is_missing_plugin_message
function.description: Checks whether @msg is a missing plugins message.
function.return: %TRUE if @msg is a missing-plugins message, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_timestamp
function.description: Get the timestamp of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The timestamp in host order.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_write
function.description:
Attempt to write @size bytes of @data to the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_cdda_base_src_add_track
function.description: CDDA sources use this function from their start vfunc to announce the available data and audio tracks to the base source class. The caller should allocate @track on the stack, the base source will do a shallow copy of the structure (and take ownership of the taglist if there is one).
function.return: FALSE on error, otherwise TRUE.

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_properties
function.description: Get a list of properties for which probing is supported.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe to get the properties for.

function.return: the list of properties for which probing is supported by this element.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_get_request_uri
function.description: Get a newly allocated string describing the request URI for @url.
function.return: a string with the request URI. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_media
function.description: Get the media description of @media.
function.return: the media description.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_marker
function.description: Check if the marker bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the marker bit set.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_get_attribute_val
function.description: Get the first attribute with key @key in @msg.
function.return: the attribute value of the first attribute with @key.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_attribute
function.description: Get the attribute at position @idx in @media.
function.return: the #GstSDPAttribute at position @idx.

function.name: gst_rtsp_method_as_text
function.description: Convert @method to a string.
function.return: a string representation of @method.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_new
function.description: Allocate a new GstSDPMessage and store the result in @msg.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_tuner_frequency_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the configured frequency changes. Fires the #GstTuner::frequency-changed signal on the tuner, and the #GstTunerChannel::frequency-changed signal on the channel.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_add_ssrc
function.description: Add @ssrc to the BYE @packet.
function.return: %TRUE if the ssrc was added. This function can return %FALSE if the max MTU is exceeded or the number of sources blocks is greater than #GST_RTCP_MAX_BYE_SSRC_COUNT.

function.name: gst_tuner_set_channel
function.description: Tunes the object to the given channel.

function.name: gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free
function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_get_reason_len
function.description: Get the length of the reason string.
function.return: The length of the reason string or 0 when there is no reason string present.

function.name: gst_missing_uri_source_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a source element for a particular URI protocol is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the URI protocol the missing source needs to implement, e.g. "http" or "mms"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip4_address
function.description: Set @naddr with the IPv4 @address and @port pair.

function.description: Get the current video norm from the given tuner object for the currently selected channel.

parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the current norm from.

function.return: the current norm.

Get the vertical flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.

function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.description: Get the connection at position @idx in @media.
function.return: the #GstSDPConnection at position @idx.

parameter.name: timedata

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_init_request
function.description: Initialize @msg as a request message with @method and @uri. To clear @msg again, use gst_rtsp_message_unset().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_pause
function.description: Pause processing samples from the ringbuffer.
function.return:
TRUE if the device could be paused, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_filter_class_add_pad_templates
function.description:
Convenience function to add pad templates to this element class, with @allowed_caps as the caps that can be handled.
This function is usually used from within a GObject base_init function.
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: allowed_caps
parameter.parameter_description: what formats the filter can handle, as #GstCaps

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_next_item
function.description: Move to the next SDES item in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if there was a next item.

function.name: gst_fft_s32_window
function.description: This calls the window function @window on the @timedata sample buffer.

function.name: gst_missing_element_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a certain required element is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the missing element (element factory), e.g. "videoscale" or "cdparanoiasrc"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_volume_changed
function.description:
Parses a volume-changed notification message and extracts the track object it refers to, as well as an array of volumes and the size of the volumes array.
The track object remains valid until the message is freed.
The caller must free the array returned in the volumes parameter using g_free when they are done with it.
Since: 0.10.14

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerTrack object, or NULL.

parameter.name: volumes
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to receive an array of gint values, or NULL.

parameter.name: num_channels
parameter.parameter_description: Result location to receive the number of channels, or NULL.

function.name: gst_missing_decoder_installer_detail_new
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string

parameter.name: decode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which a decoder element is needed

function.return:
a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_sdp_message_as_text
function.description: Convert the contents of @msg to a text string.
function.return: A dynamically allocated string representing the SDP description.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_append_headers
function.description: Append the currently configured headers in @msg to the #GString @str suitable for transmission.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_add_media
function.description: Adds @media to the array of medias in @msg. This function takes ownership of the contents of @media so that @media will have to be reinitialized with gst_media_init() before it can be used again.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_mixer_get_mixer_flags
function.description: Get the set of supported flags for this mixer implementation.
function.return: A set of or-ed GstMixerFlags for supported features.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_next_timeout
function.description: Calculate the next timeout for @conn, storing the result in @timeout.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_padding
function.description: Get the packet padding of the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: If the packet has the padding bit set.

function.name: GstTuner
function.description:
Reports that the signal strength has changed.
See Also: gst_tuner_signal_strength()

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The element providing the GstTuner interface

function.name: gst_sdp_media_add_format
function.description: Add the format information to @media.
function.return: #GST_SDP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_parse
function.description: Parse the RTSP @urlstr into a newly allocated #GstRTSPUrl. Free after usage with gst_rtsp_url_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_tag_from_vorbis_tag
function.description: Looks up the GStreamer tag for a vorbiscomment tag.

parameter.name: vorbis_tag
parameter.parameter_description: vorbiscomment tag to convert to GStreamer tag

function.return: The corresponding GStreamer tag or NULL if none exists.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strh
function.description: Parses a strh structure from input data. Takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strh
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strh structure. Caller should free it.

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_set_slave_method
function.description:
Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @src.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_commit_full

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: the sample position of the data

parameter.name: in_samples
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples in the data to commit

parameter.name: out_samples
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples to write to the ringbuffer

function.return:
The number of samples written to the ringbuffer or -1 on error. The number of samples written can be less than @out_samples when @buf was interrupted with a flush or stop.
Since: 0.10.11.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_zones_len
function.description: Get the number of time zone information entries in @msg.
function.return: the number of time zone information entries in @msg.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_emails_len
function.description: Get the number of emails in @msg.
function.return: the number of emails in @msg.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_read_internal
function.description:
Attempt to read @size bytes into @data from the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush() only if @allow_interrupt is set.

parameter.name: allow_interrupt
parameter.parameter_description: can the pending read be interrupted

function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstRingBuffer for @src. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @src as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @src.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_proto
function.description: Get the transport protocol of @media
function.return: the transport protocol of @media.

function.name: gst_color_balance_list_channels
function.description: Retrieve a list of the available channels.
function.return: A GList containing pointers to #GstColorBalanceChannel objects. The list is owned by the #GstColorBalance instance and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_chunk
function.description: Reads a single chunk.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset in the buffer in the caller. Is incremented by the read size by this function.

parameter.name: fourcc
parameter.parameter_description: fourcc (returned by this function0 of the chunk.

parameter.name: chunk_data
parameter.parameter_description: buffer (returned by the function) containing the chunk data.

function.return: the fourcc tag of this chunk, or FALSE on error

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strf_vids
function.description: Parses a video streams strf structure plus optionally some extradata from input data. This function takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strf/vids structure. Caller should free it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a buffer containing extradata for this particular stream (e.g. palette, codec initialization data).

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_fft_f64_free
function.description: This frees the memory allocated for @self.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_get_mime
function.description: Get the mime type of the transport mode @trans. This mime type is typically used to generate #GstCaps on buffers.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.
